review: Server tonight was not listening plus had to get manager to replace food.
came here for breakfast every day during my stay @hilton. can't complain. standard breakfast buffet.

Eek! Methinks not is correct! We waited 35 minutes for a table and they do not even have a real waiting area, instead you are sent to this back door and asked to wait in the Double Tree hotel lobby! We are seated and had a very friendly waitress that mixed up our order. Not to mention they never gave us silverware or napkins, we had to requests those items. i guess they serve animals that eat without using their hands.  I guess it was our fault for resorting to something we thought we count on.

Went a couple of times for a drink only b/c I was at the hotel, actually really good happy hour prices for DT Memphis, but watch out, the tax rate for drinks is about 25% which is added on the back end, so not all that great of prices. Only two TVs, and one was on the Weather Channel one day during happy hour.  Staff was loud with each other and customers didn't seem like their top priority. Plus their language and stories were not fit for a family restaurant.

Might be the most empty TGIF I've ever seen.  But with it being 2 blocks from Beale Street, I understand. It's also the room service provider for the Double Tree Hotel, which is pretty much how I experienced it. My flight didn't get in until late in the evening and by then, I was hungry and didn't feel like figuring out where Beale Street was. Had I known it was only two blocks away, I would've skipped this entirely. You're going to get TGIF quality food. Nothing more, nothing less.

My experiences at this Friday's while staying at the Double Tree were always good.  I walked in, sat at the bar, and was greeted by a funny bartender right away.  My food came out fairly quickly, and it was good!  I ordered the grilled salmon, broccoli, and mashed potatoes, for something somewhat lighter, and was very pleasantly surprised.  The Salmon had great flavor, and was cooked just right.  Broccoli was nicely steamed.  Mashed potatoes were tasty, with some of the skin still in it. On another occasion, I had the Jack Daniels Chicken Sandwich.  This is quite a sandwich.  I tend to go for lighter fare, so this was a lot of food.  It had onion rings in the sandwich, and a pretty rich sauce, which was good, but definitely not light.   I was actually hesitant to go to any Friday's, because I travel a lot, and like to experience the local food, not the same heavy stuff at a different Friday's.   But I was pleasantly surprised by the service, and the food.   I did go on off times, so there was literally no wait.

We stopped in for a beer to get off Beale Street. The management should have known every hotel was sold out for 12/30.  The parade for the Liberty bowl finished up and Fridays filled up.  My favorite part was when 2 employees ( who according to management were in training)  Sat near the front window with drinks, dessert, and a menu to take a break.  I even asked the manager why he did not get the employees back to work. He said they had only been trained for 3 days.  I think it is poor form to have employees taking breaks in the dining room.  Clearly the staff could not get food or drinks out with the staff they had.  The 2 managers never stepped in. There were many angry customers. Fridays used to have standards to included employees shadowing when training now they just get to eat and drink with the patrons and that is how they get trained!

I basically like eating here.  The music sometimes is way too loud (plus I don't like rap), so I limit my visits.  When the music isn't a problem it is good.   Coffee is absolutely horrible (at any Friday's).  They apparently use instant coffee and it is an insult to coffee.  I should give them a one-star just for their coffee.

This was not a good stop after an afternoon baseball game. The food is a little pricey for just being ok. The service needs happier helpful faces instead of grumpy vacant ones. Also don't try and order off the menu like changing a grilled chicken sandwich to fried chicken because that is not possible. When we received our check I noticed they had added a service charge and folded the bottom portion that stated the service charge was really the tip added already. They basically want to trick you into giving them tip again in hopes you didn't catch the words srv chrg on the bill! I  grew up eating TGIF and I can honestly say I won't be visiting this establishment ever again.

My daughters and I were staying right across the street at the Peabody so we thought we'd get something quick.  Were we ever wrong!  There was a system for seating patrons in order but that wasn't being used.  After about 7 groups being seated before us that had arrived after us, we left.
T.G.I. Fridays is nothing special. It is a chain restaurant. Food is average and service is okay. We eat here because it is the closest restaurant near the ball park.

The flat bread is essentially the only vegetarian item on their menu. I now know why I had never been to TGI's before and are likely to never be back again. That being said, it is a very accommodating place for large groups, but even my meat-eating companions were not overly enthusiastic about the food = your typical chain restaurant.

The manager overheard I was looking a vegan option for lunch. He offered a special creation from the Executive Chef if we were interested.  Chef Michaels portobello burger with eggplant fries and split pea and anch chili mayo was over the top outstanding. Great service as well.

Well I always thought a Memphis T.G.I Fridays would be above the rest because on the back cover of Big Star's Radio City album they are in a Fridays!  Well maybe things have changed since the mid 70's!   We were staying at a hotel connected to this Friday's and they gave us a deal on a breakfast buffet at Friday's so we took..  Not the best idea ever!   First off since we had a party of 7 we got sat in the Bar which smelled like stale beer and Mr. Clean!  Not a good combo.. Our table was really dirty, so we had our waiter (who was super nice) wipe it down.  We got up to head to the buffet and every plate we picked up was dirty I don't know if they grabbed the wrong pile or the machine is not cleaning stuff very well either way we had to tell an employee.. They switched some out pretty quick but I know my appetite was waning at that point.  I didn't eat much, and drank a bit of coffee, The manager did come by and give us a slew of free appitizer coupons that expired in about 5 days. I don't think will be coming back. Some of the food on the buffet was cold, and was not presented very well. But oh well everyone who tried and omelet like it.  The staff tried really hard and were very nice but this place could use some work.

When you go into a Fridays you generally know what to expect. Service is generally pretty good with friendly staff and food is acceptable/serviceable.   This location is what i would call special. First, it smells worse than Bourbon Street on a 100 degree Sunday morning.  I don't know how it is possible to have that smell inside of a Fridays.  It smells like swill.  Perhaps they should think about adding a little bleach to their mop water. Second, the few people we interacted with simply do not like their job and they let you know it and this included one of the managers.  It is not just the normal coldness you might get from someone who has a bad day.  No, it was more like a general crummy non-helpful attitude.  Although, I will say the hostess was friendly.  The bartender and manager were not.   We got some drinks and moved on.  The smell was just too bad to actually eat food there.

Great bar, horrible kitchen. I asked Shaun the bartender (with the mohawk)  how long would my appetizer take after waiting about 15 minutes. He laughed at me and said, "you'll be drunk before you get your food." Then, walked away. Michelle (she worked at the Winchester Road location) makes PERFECT drinks. Rick (the tall, black guy) is generally good when it's a slow night. My food came out eventually. It was on a hot plate but it was cold. How ironic!?  All in all, only come here for drinks before your next move. Do not order any food unless you plan to be here for at least 45 minutes. You do have to constantly remind your waiter to check on your food, no matter who they are.

About as bad as it gets!  Had I not been pressured to find a quick lunch, without leaving the DoubleTree hotel property, I wouldn't have risked it for anything other than the breakfast buffet (included with hotel stay), but I figured, "How bad can it be?!?"   Yep, that bad... food, service, and everything else about it.  Too many great restaurants within a few blocks to suffer through this.  TGIt's over!

The staff was nice but slow. Apprently they were understaffed but it wasn't that busy... All of the food was really good and normally there isn't that much of a wait I'm gonna go out on a limb and say last night was just an off night. They were out of green beans which was upsetting because I was really looking forward to them.

We arrived around 5PM on a Thursday. There weren't many people there and that should have been a clue. But the restaurant was in our hotel. We sat at the bar and there was only one bartender who was friendly, but appeared to be overwhelmed as service was slow.  We ordered 2 Dirty Martinis only to find out that they had no olives. Then when we ordered a Martini with a twist of lime, we got lemons instead. The appetizers were half price, hot and tasty.  I'm sure there are better places to get a drink and a bite to eat within walking distance. Don't waste your time here.
This place has gone all the way down! The food, margarita and waiter were HORRIBLE!!!!!!!! Definitely will not be returning any time soon!

After a long flight into Memphis and checking into our hotel my friends and I realized we hadn't eaten in almost 8 hours. We were glad TGI Fridays was close. Thursday afternoon around 2pm and the place was practically empty, which should mean prompt service and quick and accurate food to the table, right?  Nope. Our server couldn't have cared less that we were there, was inattentive and got our orders wrong.  The food was subpar as well, too salty broccoli cheese soup and a Chipotle chicken salad that the chicken barely walked through left me unsatisfied and thirsty. Not the place to go for a "welcome to Memphis".

Can you say gnat city!!!! Omg!!!!!! I almost returned my whole order!!!!! Service was cool, had a optimistic bartender so he kept things rolling! Jack Daniels sauce with a side of shrimp was good!!! Long island,  on point!!!! But the pest.... Gnats..gnats..gnats!!!!!! Please get rid of them!!!!

This is a nice place to grab a drink at the bar. Super friendly bartenders; especially Sean. He's attentive and funny. The food is what you'd expect from a typical bar and the same goes for the drinks. The great thing about TGI Fridays it that it's convenient to other bars and entertainment venues downtown. Great spot to stop at before heading to a rooftop party in the spring/summer time. Only negative is that there are gnats hanging around the bar :(
Waitress did not clean our table before we sat down. when we asked her take the trash  off of it she became quite slow & rude

There is clearly a lack of servers at this location and it is at a detriment to the patrons. I waited for 25 minutes to get my order taken and another 35 for my food...on a Monday! There is no excuse for the lack of service! Probably won't be going back.

And the one star goes to the bartender. I wasn't even at the bar, but he seemed to have been the best thing going.  The food was good when we did get it.  They were understaffed, intentionally or unintentionally.  It took 15 minutes to be seated, 10 minutes til our order was taken and another 30 minutes to bring us our food. So almost an hour from the door to my plate.  My waitress ignored us twice.  We had to get another waitress to refill our drinks while we waited.   Next time, I'll pack a lunch for lunch.

Holy smokes this place is bad. Not only just as a restaurant but also the side area where they serve double tree breakfast. There's no proper hostess, the food for breakfast is sparse and awful like a motel 8's continental and the service is bad. One night, husband and I came here for two beers that took over 30 minutes to get and cash out. In the morning, they messed up my omelette and asked if I wanted cheese I said no, but they gave it to me anyways. (I can't eat cheese otherwise I would have bit the bullet). On top of that I couldn't really tell who my server was. Sometimes I guess convenience isn't always the best.

TGIF has gone down to me. I mean the food is good but the menu items have gotten so expensive and there are absolutely no deals anymore. The portions are small and you don't always get great service. The only good thing would probably be the bar.

Terrible...all the way around. It has potential to be a great "after game" place when catching a Redbirds game HOWEVER...after sitting in the summer heat, all we were hoping for was some apps to go. The hostess took our order but proceeded to run around and ignored us and then came back to ask what we ordered. After being patient for 20 minutes, we finally came to see that our order was never put in because the woman in charge of that never took our order...system needs a redo.  After a polite complaint, the manager took care of our bill which was a positive move. Here is my tip: take advantage of the local joints a little further away from the field. And Fridays...get a better system so you guys can make your people happy and wanting to come after the game.

The only reason I'm not giving 1 star is due to our friendly bartender. As soon as we walked into the restaurant, the host recommended we sit at the bar without even asking if we'd like a table. There were only two of us, so sure, why not.  Once at the bar, our bartender got our drink order quickly, but it took him quite awhile to make it. I noticed he was busy, so that's not a big deal. He was very friendly and talkative, so that made up for the slow service. All throughout our dinner the service was terribly slow however, so the host should not have been pushing for people to sit at the bar if it was too much for the bartender.  I was very disappointed in our food, I ordered their balsamic chicken Caesar salad & I think I could have made a tastier salad at home. Very bland, just basically lettuce with tomatoes & "marinated" chicken. Try, cold chicken bread with some sauce smeared on it... My boyfriend had a burger and fries, which was disappointing as well. The fries were cold! But after the wait to get our food he just ate them. The burger was ok, you could get a better burger at five guys. All around disappointing visit and we will not be back.

Was staying at the Doubletree Hotel and this TGIFridays is connected to the hotel in a good location downtown. It was pretty dead for lunch on a Tuesday around noon. I was seated immediately and then promptly forgot about. The original host finally came back to take my drink order about 10 minutes later. Then another 10 minutes passes and my server finally comes to take my order. This is not acceptable! It's a good thing I wasn't in a hurry otherwise I would have walked out the door. Food was overall average. Would not recommend this place based on lack of service or attention to customers.

Walked into Friday's  and was offered an immediate seat at the bar where we were greeted  by  an awesome  bartender  he had so much energy  and kept the atmosphere  live and upbeat we had a great time the food was good the drinks good and strong  we truly  enjoyed  our visit

This particular location is the most dysfunctional TGI Friday's I have ever experienced. The bar staff is attentive but the place is in horrible condition. 3/4 of the beer taps are inoperative, there seems to be no cooperation between the wait staff and the bar staff forcing the bartender to go clear across the building to retrieve orders. Food presentation is sloppy and unappealing.  Its rather sad and the management of this location needs to take stock of the situation here.

The food was good.  I didn't like how the hostess suggested we sit in the bar since there were only 2 of us. Uhhh how about you ask where I wanna sit? And the bar seemed like the busiest area. Why would you suggest that?  The atmosphere was weird....like it tangibly felt weird. Moist....idk I wouldn't go there again.

Ew.  I don't even know where to start.  We tried this place twice thinking maybe Day 1 was a fluke.  Nope. We stayed at the Doubletree Hilton that is attached to the Fridays.  As a Hilton Diamond Rewards member, I was told that breakfast at the Fridays was complimentary.  Ok--we can check it out.   When we walked in the door, there was a server sitting down at a table who told us we could sit wherever we wanted.  We looked around.  All of the open tables were dirty.  So somebody said they would clean off the table and get us coffee and water.  They said the buffet included omelets made to order.  I asked the server for an omelet.  She said she would put in the order.  We went through the buffet line and then sat down.  A different server was serving us at our table.  After waiting about 20 minutes, we asked server number 2 about my omelet.  She had no idea there was an omelet ordered for me.  She disappeared.  A third person came out and said my omelet would be coming up.  Apparently nobody put in the order.  When the omelet came out, it was undercooked.  Runny eggwhites.  Not good. The food on the buffet was okay.  Fresh fruit, cereal, juice, oatmeal, scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausage, biscuits and gravy.  It was okay for a buffet. The real issue was the service.  While the servers were very nice, they were very slow.   Day 2.  Let's try this again.  Walked in.  Knew we could sit wherever.  Dirty tables again.  Was offered a table and somebody would come by to clean it up.  The table across from us had an overflowing bus tub on the table.  Just sitting there.  Full.  Dishes scattered around on the table.  Trash on the floor.  Nobody came to pick it up.  It was there when we got there and 45 minutes into our breakfast, it was still there.  No excuse for it.  The restaurant was not even busy.  I finally picked up the trash on the floor and put it in the bus tub because I did not want somebody to step or trip on it.   My omelet was ordered and came to me in a timely fashion.  Eggwhites cooked.  Good.  Now where's that coffee?  It took a while for our server to come back.  We asked for a refill on coffee and she said it was brewing.  We waited and waited...and waited.  In the meantime, ALL of the tables around us were empty and dirty.   Nobody was wiping anything up.  Somebody came from the back and picked up the bus tub.  But left the other dishes on the table.  Then another bus tub appeared on the table next to it with dishes in it.  That one stayed on the table until we left.   I saw the manager in the bar area taking stools off tables as he prepared to open for the restaurant.  I never saw him walking around the open "breakfast" area of the restaurant to see how things were.  Then a woman came in by herself.  He walked her over to our area and there were no clean tables.  He called out "Any clean tables back here?"  And then sat her in the back.  WTF?  Doesn't he see the gross, dirty state of his dining room? I just don't know where restaurant standards went at this place.  Heck, where did ANY standards go?? Don't go to Fridays.  Not even for a free breakfast.  If the dining area that customers can actually see is this dirty, I can only imagine with the kitchen looks like.

My husband and I would have loved to have eaten here. I work around Southaven and finally had an opportunity to stop. We had to stop a waitress to even get seated because there was no hostess manning the door. She ended up getting a guy (possibly a Manager because he had on a polo shirt) to seat us. We noticed several empty tables which were all dirty walking back to our table. The floor was also filthy. We were given menus which were dirty and sticky. After sitting there for 10 mins (we waited 5 mins at the door waiting to be noticed) we got up and left. We had 3 servers pass our table along with the same guy that seated us and no one ever spoke to us or offered to wait on us. I gave it one star because you have to give them something.
Took my nephew out to celebrate his graduation.  Although, it was late, the food and service were very good.  Thanks!
Amazing bartenders, super friendly and creative with the drinks. Good food and it came out fast!

Was on my way to Beale St. and wanted a quick nationally consistent steak. 10 oz strip and sides were great. However took way too long to get a beer as bartender more interested in spewing his BS to female. Food came via server which left me in the hands of Mr. Inattenative. Another wait for knife and fork. No salt/pepper which I removed from a nearby table. No follow up to the food. After meal, time to head out. Convenient that running tab is left in glass on bar so further wait time is eliminated.Bill was 28.50 dropped a 20 and a 10. Hope tip went to server.

Stopped by while walking with my dad. I haven't eaten at a Fridays before so we each got something from the lunch menu. I got the chicken Cajun pasta with the mozzarella sticks and my dad got the sliders with fries and clam chowder soup. I liked how mozza sticks had a really thin coat of breading and more cheese. My dad liked his meal as well. The highlight though was our server, Decree. If it weren't for him I'd be giving less stars since the food was okay, but he made our lunch an experience and would keep cracking jokes and ask us if things were fine.
Delicious dinner here last night with the family!!! Sweet service, dirty menus, knowledgeable staff, perfect strawberry lemonade, and clean with nice lighting!!! My type of place!!

Stayed in the hotel and ate appetizers , good all the way around , had the soap dish in hotel to fall off but hotel comped is with free breakfast which was great also , will def eat and stay there again

I have been in Memphis since Monday (11 AM) and leave Wednesday Evening.  I am staying at the Doubletree which is attached to the TGI Fridays on Union.  Hence my review covers multiple sanctions of this property. The bar at this Fridays is 5 stars.  The margarita I am drinking right now rivals Los Angeles' best.  It is a flawless Sauza Anejo cocktail with a Grand Marnier base.  I LOVE the bar at this Fridays. The food is better than the folks whom write bad reviews.  Yesterday I had a chicken cobb salad to go which was 5 stars.  Right now I am eating loaded potato skins.  They are delicious. This is an awesome Fridays.  Fact is I could easily drink and dine here.
I called ahead of time and asked if I got get there and get a table.. Well when I got there it was a different story they was rude about getting my table ready.. the mixed drinks was a waste of time

We waited over 30 minutes after our drinks were ordered for them to be delivered and another 40 beyond that for the food.  It was not crowded just totally disorganized.  The servers were nice, but just could not get it together for a timely meal.   when the food arrived, half of my colleague's salad was wilted to the point it belonged in the garbage.  Very disappointing.  Kind of crazy to have this experience at such a large chain.

Absolute horrible service waiting 35 minutes to get a drink order alone. Sat there for 90 minutes and still didn't get food. While we were waiting for our food, two customers raised their voices to the bartender. They had their food within 20 minutes, paid their ticket and left. We still had not received our dinner. We asked to speak with manager and he wouldn't even come out of kitchen to help us. Our poor waitress repeatedly apologized but it wasn't her fault. Absolute worst ever.

Very friendly and welcoming restaurant. Attached to a hotel and in the middle of all of stuff downtown. Food is made to order as usual and tastes great. Got mozzarella sticks for appitizer, Jack Daniels burger and wife has grilled salmon dinner with rice. Great atmosphere and close to everything downtown. Relocating to Memphis and think it will be a great experience. @tgifridays

Very slow service, my husbands food came a good 20 minutes before mine and we both only ordered appetizers. Do not recommend at all and even though they are located inside the hotel I will not be back.

Bait and Switch - Endless Appetizers  A group of ten us went to the TGIF in the downtown area for lunch and half of the group order the $10 Endless Appetizers.  The food was overall good and the waitress provided great services.  However the manner in which they billed the endless appetizer orders was totally unacceptable and even seemed illegal.  Each time a appetizer was order, there was a $5 charged to the bill.  Although the various $5 charges were removed from the bill but not before totaling the bill and adding a 18% gratuity, which meant the $10 Endless Appetizer and $3 soda resulted in a $22 bill.  When asked for an explanation from the manager, he was just rude and kept saying the bill is the bill and just pay it.  Stay away from the endless appetizer at this place.

Clean. Not that customer care matters first...First time being here. The gentleman helped us and made sure we were taking care of. The question remains how can a black family sit down for 25 minutes before being served for DRINKS, but a white man can sit down and be served in two minutes... I trying my best notto be radical, but who has the answers? Rude servers. No tip. SIMPLE. We had to ask for plates, silverware, kidnap napkins, and attitudes!

My sister and I went downtown for a quick drink and snack to catch up. We sat at the bar and I told one of  the best bartender in Memphis(or the best that I have had) to make us a specialty of his. He made us ,"The Captain Morgan Rum Punch" aka "Roofiecolida"! It was super good and you only need 1! I had the Jack Daniels steak and it was cooked perfectly.. only negative is the nats.. but that's every restaurant in downtown Memphis.

Very strange experience at this restaurant - hostess rolled her eyes at us when we asked to sit by the TVs in the bar to watch the game. Waitress can't hear at all and took the wrong order for our appetizer then brought out the wrong thing two different times. I ordered a glass of Pinot Grigio and she tells me they were almost out so she topped off my glass with some "top shelf" Chardonnay. That's not how wine works. Then she doesn't know how to split a bill so she tells us to just pay each other. Update: waitress stares me down while I sign the check so I couldn't tip accordingly

Anisa Hawkins was our server. We sat in the booth the right of the entrance. She stood on the TOP OF THE STAIRS facing behind the booth facing the window instead of at the table where there is no booth or chair. I had to turn my neck like the exorcist because she wanted to take my order standing behind my head (I ordered everyone's food so no one else had to speak).  She couldn't hear everything I was saying so she FINALLY just leaned in to hear what I was saying. I'll update when the food gets here but we were seated quickly 5:15pm on a Saturday...

Took forever to sit down even when there were hardly any people. Waiter took forever to come take care of Us when we told her what we wanted she was beyond rude she smelled like straight weed. Food was good but she was terrible will never go back again. This was the first restaurant that I left no tip.

The hostess was nice and very polite. Our server was professional, friendly, and waited on us in a timely manner. My family had the sizzler chicken and shrimp. I had a turkey burger which was very good. I also help my family eat their fried shrimps. Our drinks stay full because our server continue to bring out drinks. Overall this is the best TGIF I been too.

I really don't want to waste my time discussing the poor help in this establishment. 6:00p and no host/hostess to be found. Waited 15 minutes until someone finally sat me for dinner. Table was covered in food and water. Rest of the dining area was dirty and nasty. Waitress and I had a specific conversation that I had wanted the soup served before my steak dinner; you guessed it, the steak arrives, no soup. I reminded the waitress of our conversation, and she says "So what Chad wanna do about it? She got nasty, had a negative unapologetic attitude as if it was my fault. I walked out. I DO NOT RECOMMEND this TGI Friday's for a sit down meal. Shame on you!

Downtown here with the best bar tenders in Memphis, tn., Sean n Rick. Whenever I come down they treat me right. I have never had a problem with them and they know me when I come here. They r the best.

EXTREMELY RUDE HOSTESS!!!  We arrived at 7:15pm on 12/30/17.  Hostess said it was a 30 to 35 minute wait which was not a problem as we went to the bar and ordered drinks.  The place was clearing out by 8pm and we still had not been seated.  We found the hostess and ask for a table in the bar and she said she would have to specify that on her waiting list but we were clearly the only name not crossed off at this point.  Another couple in the bar had already eaten but were cold so they moved to a different table to be a little warmer.  She approached them and told them they had to return to their original table because the bar was assigned seating.  The couple mentioned that they were cold and just wanted to move away from the door.  To which she refused to move them.  At this point their were 5 tables in the bar that had not been cleared off.  Customers had left and the staff was just hanging out in the corner doing NOTHING.  The hostess tried to offer us the booth that she refused that couple but we asked if they could possibly clear a tall table for us (my husband is a big guy and doesn't do booths very well). So we thought they were going to clear a table for us.  In the mean time, customers were walking into the restaurant and were getting seated immediately and we had waited for over an hour while by the time we decided to walk out and go somewhere else there were 8 tables empty but full of dirty dishes.  As a restaurant owner myself, this would absolutely never happen at our place.  Customer service should be your #1 priority.  Without customers you have nothing.  Now I see why this location only has 2 1/2 stars.  EPIC FAIL TGI FRIDAYS!
